citation.article-title: Sulfuricella denitrificans gen. nov., sp. nov., a sulfur-oxidizing autotroph isolated from a freshwater lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sulfuricella denitrificans sp. nov.
Sulfuricella denitrificans (de.ni.tri′fi.cans. N.L. v. denitrifico to denitrify; N.L. part. adj. denitrificans denitrifying).
Displays the following properties in addition to those described for the genus.
Cells are Gram-negative rods, 0.8–2.0 μm long and 0.4–0.6 μm wide.
Autotrophic growth occurs with oxidation of thiosulfate and elemental sulfur to sulfate.
Grows at temperatures lower than 28 °C, with optimum growth at 22 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.0–9.0; optimum growth occurs at pH 7.5–8.0.
Does not require NaCl for growth, and does not grow at above 220 mM NaCl.
The G+C content of genomic DNA of the type strain is 59 mol%.
The type strain, skB26T (=NBRC 105220T =DSM 22764T), was isolated from anoxic lake water of a stratified freshwater lake.
